name: What Do They Study? Quiz | Vocabulary | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Insects.

	Entomologists play many roles; they study beneficial insects as well as harmful ones.

Mollusks.

	Malacologists may study food-producing mollusks. Another big field is paleontological malacology- studying shell fossils.

Birds.

	Ornithologists have over 20,000 species to study!

Wines.

	If you pronounce the word correctly, it will give you a clue as to its definition.

Fungi.

	Mycologists study molds, rusts and yeasts as well as mushrooms.

Stamps.

	Stamp collecting is one of the most popular hobbies in the world.

Coins.

	This derives from the name of a Greek coin, which derived its name from "nomos"- "law."

Baseball statistics.

	The name comes from an acronym- "Society for American Baseball Research," or SABR.

Language.

	The philologist has many fields of study, including extinct and dying languages, of which there are many.

The flow of matter.

	This is an important field of physics.
